channel.title: What Laptops are nice for music?
channel.description:
I know this doesn’t really pertain to Auxy but, what computers are nice for DAWS and music production overall? and relatively not expensive?
Thanks for any replies—Reaper2.0

item.title: What Laptops are nice for music?
item.dc:creator: Norfleet
item.description:
Produk:

Linux for noobs

Well, to be fair, many people do think it’s not a great operating system – it’s definitely true that most consumer-oriented apps aren’t made for Linux. However, it’s very good for hosting a web server or running scripts (usually, many scripts are pre-installed).

Read full topic

I still have to get a laptop though.

Read full topic
item.source: What Laptops are nice for music?

item.title: What Laptops are nice for music?
item.dc:creator: DontPartyWithGuns
item.description:
It depends. If you want Logic, Ableton, Cubase, Reason, or any other professional daw, get a mac (and like other people are saying, get a big one with lots of space because they run out fast).

If you want Ableton, LMMS, FL Studio or Magix Music Making Software / MMMS (ew, I used to use MMMS, it sucks) then get a Windows.

If you want LMMS (and nothing else as far as I know) get a Linux. Except dont get a Linux, you really cant do anything on them except coding.

When getting a new computer, my motto is always
“Apple for music, Windows for Games, and Linux for coding”

Read full topic
item.source: What Laptops are nice for music?

item.title: What Laptops are nice for music?
item.dc:creator: Ninjendo
item.description:
Not really. Ableton did a promotion to buy ableton 9 Live get the update to Live 10 for free. But you pay for the upgrade. FL just sells you the program and you get updates for life. Logic has free updates until a completely new version comes out. Studio One gives free updates.
Reason idk. Cubase idk, and any other DAW idk.

Read full topic
